scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. During a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You suggested taking a pause to rethink the approach. Now, with the team gathered again, [Monica] leaned back in her chair, crossing her arms, and said, 'So, what's the new grand plan?' You motivated the team by recalling past successes and urging them to tackle the challenge head-on. However, the tension is still palpable. [Bob] leaned forward, sighing, 'I just don't see how we can pull this off without burning out.' You acknowledged Bob's concern and suggested practical solutions like reallocating tasks or bringing in additional help. The team looks slightly relieved but still wary.
scenes.description: [Monica] rolls her eyes and says, 'So, who exactly is going to help us out? We’re already stretched thin.'

options.text: We may need to discuss with upper management about bringing in temporary support or redistributing some of our current workload.
options.analysis: You addressed Monica's concerns directly and suggested a practical solution, demonstrating high empathy and good emotional perception.

options.text: I understand it's tough, but maybe we can look at our schedules and see if there are any non-urgent tasks we can put on hold.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the difficulty and suggested a practical step to prioritize tasks, showing good self-regulation and motivational skills.

options.text: We’ve managed to pull through tough times before without additional help. We just need to focus and push harder.
options.analysis: You relied on motivation and past successes to drive the team, showing high motivation but lower empathy and emotional perception.
